title: Woman draws bold eyebrows on her fair-haired newborn
text:
A mother desperate to see what her newborn would like with eyebrows has shared the results after drawing a pair on the fair-haired tot.

Whipping out her make-up powder, Danielle McSherry-Schee, 27, from Fife, Scotland, created bold new eyebrows for her daughter Isabella as she slept.

The stay-at-home mother joked that she was teaching the six-week-old baby 'not to fall asleep at parties' when posting the results on Facebook.

And while most people thought it was funny, there were some disapproving parents who claimed that what she'd done was 'child abuse'.

Danielle McSherry-Schee, 27, from Fife, Scotland, created bold new eyebrows for her daughter Isabella (pictured) as she slept on October 22

The stay-at-home mother (pictured with her daughter) joked that she was teaching the six-week-old baby 'not to fall asleep at parties' when posting the results on Facebook

Danielle said: 'Isabella has really fair hair and basically no eyebrows - I have always wondered what Isabella will look like with them.

'And one day a wave of inspiration came over me and I had to draw them on. I used my powder and just lightly drew on symmetrical eyebrows, a bit like mine.

She continued: 'I couldn't stop laughing which woke Isabella up so I took a quick photo and wiped them off.

'My friends and I haven't stopped laughing. It is a photo I will keep forever and I might even put it on her 18th birthday cake.'

After posting the picture of her baby (pictured) with drawn on eyebrows to a Facebook group, Danielle said the reaction has been priceless

After posting the picture of her baby with drawn on eyebrows to a Facebook group, Danielle said the reaction has been priceless.

'Everyone found the photo as funny as I did,' the mother insists.

However she did admit that some didn't see the amusing side and disapproved of her antics.

'Some people commented saying it is "child abuse", Danielle said. 'Which made me feel like I had done something wrong.

'But I didn't put my baby in danger and the other mothers in the Facebook group defended me. I would probably do it again because it is that funny!'
description: Danielle McSherry-Schee, 27, from Fife, Scotland, created bold new eyebrows for her daughter Isabella as she slept, using make-up powder, and posted the results to Facebook.
